intro: Catalepidia heyana, commonly known as the white-flowered catalepidia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, and it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. Catalepidia heyana is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils.
